newsitem.title: USA: Outback Steakhouse falls in heavy trade.
newsitem.headline: Outback Steakhouse falls in heavy trade.

text.p: Outback Steakhouse Inc's shares fell to a 12-month low in heavy Friday morning trade, hit by its announcement that first quarter earnings would be below expectations.

Shares in the Tampa, Fla., restaurant chain fell 4-1/8 to 19-1/2, a 12-month low. Volume was 3.8 million shares, or more than 12 times normal daily trade, and Outback was among the most-active shares on the Nasdaq.
The drop was "because the earnings were less than I guess everybody had expected," a trader said.
The company said after the market closed on Thursday that it expected earnings for the quarter ending March 31 to fall short of analysts' expectations of $0.40 to $0.41 a share.
Outback said it expected earnings to be 10 to 12 percent below analysts' forecasts. The shortfall was blamed on soft February and March sales.
Merrill Lynch, Alex. Brown and Raymond James all cut their ratings for the restaurant chain.
